name: Hanyuuda Chizuru
desc: A yokai that emerged from an object and assumed a human form outside of her own body. She is a Tsukumogami.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>December 19, 2022</color>
Simply put, Akitsu Haneasobi is a game where you use hagoita to hit a ball towards a set target, which tests one's speed, endurance, and directional control.
You can play this game alone, but if you want to cooperate or compete with someone else, you will need to find the right partner to enjoy it fully.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

customize.name: Youkai
customize.desc: A group of nearly extinct supernatural beings from Inazuma.

customize.text: Hanyuuda Chizuru is a Tsukumogami, a youkai that emerged from the pair of hagoita and assumed a human form outside of her own body.

customize.name: Mikawa Flower Festival
customize.desc: The Mikawa Flower Festival is an ancient Youkai festival associated with games, fun, music, and drinks.

customize.text:
Hanyuuda Chizuru was born at the Mikawa Flower Festival, so a love of fun was in her nature.
Yanagibashi Takuto
A mortal samurai whose friendship with the youkai Kamai was discovered by Chizuru when she had not yet acquired the power of a youkai.
Kamai Kenji
A youkai and friend of the mortal samurai. His power awakened the consciousness within the pair of hagoita that Kamai and the samurai played Akitsu

customize.name: Yae Miko
customize.desc: Lady Guuji of the Grand Narukami Shrine. Also serves as the editor-in-chief of Yae Publishing House. Unimaginable intelligence and cunning are hidden under her beautiful appearance.

customize.text: A kitsune, who saw the birth of Chizuru's consciousness inside the pair of hagoita. She convinced Chizuru of the value of human-youkai friendship.

customize.name: Shikanoin Heizou
customize.desc: A young prodigy detective from the Tenryou Commission. His senses are sharp and his thoughts are clear.

customize.text: A detective, who guessed Hanyuuda Chizuru's true identity right

customize.name: Kappa
customize.desc: A little youkai who wanted to revive the Mikawa Flower Festival.

customize.name: Youko
customize.desc: A little youkai who wanted to revive the Mikawa Flower Festival.

customize.name: Hitotsume Kozou
customize.desc: A little youkai who tried to revive the Mikawa Flower Festival.

customize.text: Little youkai whom Chizuru wanted to protect

Many years ago, when Hanyuuda Chizuru was just gaining consciousness, a human samurai, Yanagibashi Takuto, once stumbled across the Mikawa Flower Festival. There he met a youkai, Kamai, who asked him to join and celebrate the festival together. The two competed in the highlight of the festival: Akitsu Haneasobi. Their spectacular game ended in a draw, and a new friendship was forged between the mortal and the youkai.

The samurai turned out to be a swordsman who was traveling the world in search of formidable opponents to improve his skills. The youkai suggested that they meet once every ten years to compare their skills. The fight with Kamai showed him many new movements, which later helped open the Souran Isshin Art.

Ten years later, when the samurai was already 35, they met again at a festival. They spent time together drinking, traveling, and sparring. When they first met, they merely respected each other, but ten years later, they became best friends. After another decade, the samurai had reached the pinnacle of his swordsmanship and won a duel by a narrow margin, which forced Kamai to prepare diligently and wait for the next meeting. However, another ten years later, the samurai did not come to the meeting, as he went to defend the border in the south during the war.

When they last met, the samurai was already 65. His hair had turned gray, his body was riddled with scars, and he could no longer fight. Kamai suggested playing the final round of Akitsu Haneasobi together. The samurai gave his best effort during the game but had to quit halfway because he was too weak. Kamai, realizing that this was their last meeting, sighed sadly and said: <color=#ffffffd9>"What a shame."</color>

Back then, Hanyuuda Chizuru was a pair of hagoita used by the samurai and the youkai in Akitsu Haneasobi, and gradually developed sentience after being influenced by great yokai power. At first, Chizuru was delighted when she discovered that she could take on a human form. She came into being in the middle of a festival, so naturally, she enjoyed the lively festival atmosphere. Chizuru wanted to go to more festivals, become friends with humans, and play Akitsu Yuugei (the modernized version of Akitsu Haneasobi) with them, but every evening as night began to set in, she'd recall the bitter smile of the old samurai as he set down the hagoita, and the lonely Kamai sighing as he drank his sake. She would wonder if she became friends with a human, would that person experience the same melancholy in the future? As a result, Chizuru told herself not to repeat the same mistake and not communicate with people.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

Many years later, during another Mikawa Flower Festival, the Yashiro Commission decided to arrange a Test of Courage in the Chinju Forest. During this test, participants had to find a specific object by following clues. Near the test on the coast, the game Akitsu Yuugei appeared, which awakened Hanyuuda Chizuru.
Chizuru decided to scare people away from the forest so that the little youkai living there would not be able to make friends with people and experience suffering. Since her powers were almost gone, she had to use props to scare people. After meeting the Traveler and Paimon, she agreed to play a round of Akitsu Yuugei with them, with the condition that the loser will have to grant the winner a wish. Having won the round easily, Chizuru wished to never cross paths with the Traveler and Paimon again and disappeared.
A few days later, during the third round of the Test of Courage, Traveler, Paimon, Heizou, who was investigating the occurrence of the Akitsu Yuugei game kiosk, and the Guuji of the Grand Narukami Shrine, Yae Miko, met Chizuru again. They guessed that the hagoita chosen for the search in the third round was Chizuru's true form, which was why she appeared at the festival. Yae Miko told Chizuru that the friendship between a mortal samurai and a youkai did not end with the death of the samurai. The third-generation samurai heir, Tominaga Masanari, also became friends with Kamai, and they later fought side by side during the Cataclysm 500 years ago. The regrets that had been tormenting Kamai over the death of his old friend finally dissipated.
Having dealt with her complex feelings, Hanyuda Chizuru made another wish for the Traveler, since the previous one was not fulfilled:

<color=#ffffffd9>"My wish is...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I wish that every day of your journey ahead will be filled with joy like a festival."</color>

During the fireworks display for the Flower Festival, the youkai's power dissipated, and Chizuru disappeared without a trace.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>
